speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: SCENE IV. Paris. The KING's palace.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Enter HELENA and Clown

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: My mother greets me kindly; is she well?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: She is not well; but yet she has her health: she's

speaker: Clown
text_entry: very merry; but yet she is not well: but thanks be

speaker: Clown
text_entry: given, she's very well and wants nothing i', the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: world; but yet she is not well.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: If she be very well, what does she ail, that she's

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: not very well?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Truly, she's very well indeed, but for two things.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: What two things?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: One, that she's not in heaven, whither God send her

speaker: Clown
text_entry: quickly! the other that she's in earth, from whence

speaker: Clown
text_entry: God send her quickly!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Enter PAROLLES

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Bless you, my fortunate lady!

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I hope, sir, I have your good will to have mine own

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: good fortunes.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: You had my prayers to lead them on; and to keep them

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: on, have them still. O, my knave, how does my old lady?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: So that you had her wrinkles and I her money,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I would she did as you say.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Why, I say nothing.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Marry, you are the wiser man; for many a man's

speaker: Clown
text_entry: tongue shakes out his master's undoing: to say

speaker: Clown
text_entry: nothing, to do nothing, to know nothing, and to have

speaker: Clown
text_entry: nothing, is to be a great part of your title; which

speaker: Clown
text_entry: is within a very little of nothing.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Away! thou'rt a knave.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: You should have said, sir, before a knave thou'rt a

speaker: Clown
text_entry: knave; that's, before me thou'rt a knave: this had

speaker: Clown
text_entry: been truth, sir.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Go to, thou art a witty fool; I have found thee.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Did you find me in yourself, sir? or were you

speaker: Clown
text_entry: taught to find me? The search, sir, was profitable;

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and much fool may you find in you, even to the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: world's pleasure and the increase of laughter.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: A good knave, i' faith, and well fed.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Madam, my lord will go away to-night;

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: A very serious business calls on him.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: The great prerogative and rite of love,

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Which, as your due, time claims, he does acknowledge;

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: But puts it off to a compell'd restraint;

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Whose want, and whose delay, is strew'd with sweets,

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Which they distil now in the curbed time,

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: To make the coming hour o'erflow with joy

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: And pleasure drown the brim.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: What's his will else?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: That you will take your instant leave o' the king

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: And make this haste as your own good proceeding,

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Strengthen'd with what apology you think

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: May make it probable need.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: What more commands he?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: That, having this obtain'd, you presently

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Attend his further pleasure.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: In every thing I wait upon his will.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: I shall report it so.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I pray you.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Exit PAROLLES

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Come, sirrah.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Exeunt
